line: I doubt not, uncle, of our victory.

speaker: YORK
line: Many a battle have I won in France,

speaker: YORK
line: When as the enemy hath been ten to one:

speaker: YORK
line: Why should I not now have the like success?

speaker: YORK
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Ah, whither shall I fly to 'scape their hands?

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: As for the brat of this accursed duke,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Whose father slew my father, he shall die.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: Tutor
line: And I, my lord, will bear him company.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Soldiers, away with him!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: Tutor
line: Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: Tutor
line: Lest thou be hated both of God and man!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: How now! is he dead already? or is it fear

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: That makes him close his eyes? I'll open them.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: So looks the pent-up lion o'er the wretch

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: That trembles under his devouring paws;

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: And so he walks, insulting o'er his prey,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: And not with such a cruel threatening look.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: I am too mean a subject for thy wrath:

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: In vain thou speak'st, poor boy; my father's blood

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Hath stopp'd the passage where thy words should enter.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Then let my father's blood open it again:

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Were not revenge sufficient for me;

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: No, if I digg'd up thy forefathers' graves

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And hung their rotten coffins up in chains,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: The sight of any of the house of York

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Is as a fury to torment my soul;

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And till I root out their accursed line

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And leave not one alive, I live in hell.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Therefore--

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: O, let me pray before I take my death!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: To thee I pray; sweet Clifford, pity me!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Such pity as my rapier's point affords.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me?

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Thy father hath.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: But 'twas ere I was born.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Thou hast one son; for his sake pity me,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: He be as miserably slain as I.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Ah, let me live in prison all my days;

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: And when I give occasion of offence,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: No cause!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Thy father slew my father; therefore, die.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: RUTLAND
line: Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet!

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood,

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both.

scene: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

speaker: YORK
line: My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;

speaker: YORK
line: And all my followers to the eager foe

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
line: Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.

speaker: YORK
line: My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:

speaker: YORK
line: But this I know, they have demean'd themselves

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: Like men born to renown by life or death.

speaker: YORK
line: Three times did Richard make a lane to me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: And full as oft came Edward to my side,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: With purple falchion, painted to the hilt

speaker: YORK
line: In blood of those that had encounter'd him:

speaker: YORK
line: And when the hardiest warriors did retire,

speaker: YORK
line: Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
line: The sands are number'd that make up my life;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK

line: Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And made an evening at the noontide prick.

speaker: YORK
line: My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
line: And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?

speaker: CLIFFORD

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Breathe out invectives 'gainst the officers.

speaker: YORK
line: O Clifford, but bethink thee once again,

speaker: YORK
line: And in thy thought o'er-run my former time;

speaker: YORK
line: And, if though canst for blushing, view this face,

speaker: YORK
line: And bite thy tongue, that slanders him with cowardice

speaker: YORK
line: Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!

line: I will not bandy with thee word for word,

line: But buckle with thee blows, twice two for one.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Hold, Clifford! do not honour him so much

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

speaker: YORK

line: And made a preachment of your high descent?

line: The wanton Edward, and the lusty George?

line: And where's that valiant crook-back prodigy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?

line: Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood

line: I should lament thy miserable state.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I prithee, grieve, to make me merry, York.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: What, hath thy fiery heart so parch'd thine entrails

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: York cannot speak, unless he wear a crown.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: But how is it that great Plantagenet

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: Off with the crown, and with the crown his head;

line: Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!

line: How ill-beseeming is it in thy sex

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK

line: 'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;

line: O tiger's heart wrapt in a woman's hide!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
line: Keep thou the napkin, and go boast of this:

speaker: YORK
line: And if thou tell'st the heavy story right,

speaker: YORK

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: And say 'Alas, it was a piteous deed!'

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: There, take the crown, and, with the crown, my curse;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
line: As now I reap at thy too cruel hand!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: YORK
line: Hard-hearted Clifford, take me from the world:

speaker: YORK
line: My soul to heaven, my blood upon your heads!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
line: Had he been slaughter-man to all my kin,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: To see how inly sorrow gripes his soul.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line: Can pluck the diadem from faint Henry's head,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And wring the awful sceptre from his fist,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Were he as famous and as bold in war

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: As he is famed for mildness, peace, and prayer.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: I know it well, Lord Warwick; blame me not:

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: 'Tis love I bear thy glories makes me speak.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: But in this troublous time what's to be done?

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Shall we go throw away our coats of steel,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: And wrap our bodies in black mourning gowns,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Numbering our Ave-Maries with our beads?

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Or shall we on the helmets of our foes

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Tell our devotion with revengeful arms?

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: If for the last, say ay, and to it, lords.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Why, therefore Warwick came to seek you out;

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And therefore comes my brother Montague.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Attend me, lords. The proud insulting queen,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With Clifford and the haught Northumberland,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And of their feather many more proud birds,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Have wrought the easy-melting king like wax.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: He swore consent to your succession,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: His oath enrolled in the parliament;

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And now to London all the crew are gone,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To frustrate both his oath and what beside

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: May make against the house of Lancaster.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Their power, I think, is thirty thousand strong:

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Now, if the help of Norfolk and myself,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With all the friends that thou, brave Earl of March,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Amongst the loving Welshmen canst procure,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Will but amount to five and twenty thousand,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Why, Via! to London will we march amain,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And once again bestride our foaming steeds,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And once again cry 'Charge upon our foes!'

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But never once again turn back and fly.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Ay, now methinks I hear great Warwick speak:

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Ne'er may he live to see a sunshine day,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: That cries 'Retire,' if Warwick bid him stay.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Lord Warwick, on thy shoulder will I lean;

speaker: EDWARD
line: And when thou fail'st--as God forbid the hour!--

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Must Edward fall, which peril heaven forfend!

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: No longer Earl of March, but Duke of York:

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: The next degree is England's royal throne;

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For King of England shalt thou be proclaim'd

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: In every borough as we pass along;

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And he that throws not up his cap for joy

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Shall for the fault make forfeit of his head.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: King Edward, valiant Richard, Montague,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Stay we no longer, dreaming of renown,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: But sound the trumpets, and about our task.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: Then, Clifford, were thy heart as hard as steel,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: As thou hast shown it flinty by thy deeds,

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: I come to pierce it, or to give thee mine.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line: Then strike up drums: God and Saint George for us!

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.
speaker: Messenger

scene: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Welcome, my lord, to this brave town of York.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yonder's the head of that arch-enemy

line: That sought to be encompass'd with your crown:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Doth not the object cheer your heart, my lord?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ay, as the rocks cheer them that fear their wreck:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To see this sight, it irks my very soul.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Withhold revenge, dear God! 'tis not my fault,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Nor wittingly have I infringed my vow.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: My gracious liege, this too much lenity

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And harmful pity must be laid aside.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: To whom do lions cast their gentle looks?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Not to the beast that would usurp their den.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Whose hand is that the forest bear doth lick?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Not his that spoils her young before her face.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Who 'scapes the lurking serpent's mortal sting?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Not he that sets his foot upon her back.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: The smallest worm will turn being trodden on,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And doves will peck in safeguard of their brood.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Ambitious York doth level at thy crown,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Thou smiling while he knit his angry brows:

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: He, but a duke, would have his son a king,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And raise his issue, like a loving sire;

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Thou, being a king, blest with a goodly son,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Didst yield consent to disinherit him,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Which argued thee a most unloving father.

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Unreasonable creatures feed their young;

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And though man's face be fearful to their eyes,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Yet, in protection of their tender ones,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Who hath not seen them, even with those wings

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Which sometime they have used with fearful flight,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Make war with him that climb'd unto their nest,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Offer their own lives in their young's defence?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: For shame, my liege, make them your precedent!

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Were it not pity that this goodly boy

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Should lose his birthright by his father's fault,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And long hereafter say unto his child,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: 'What my great-grandfather and his grandsire got

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: My careless father fondly gave away'?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Ah, what a shame were this! Look on the boy;

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And let his manly face, which promiseth

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Successful fortune, steel thy melting heart

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: To hold thine own and leave thine own with him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Full well hath Clifford play'd the orator,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Inferring arguments of mighty force.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But, Clifford, tell me, didst thou never hear

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That things ill-got had ever bad success?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And happy always was it for that son

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose father for his hoarding went to hell?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I'll leave my son my virtuous deeds behind;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And would my father had left me no more!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For all the rest is held at such a rate

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: As brings a thousand-fold more care to keep

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than in possession and jot of pleasure.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, cousin York! would thy best friends did know

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How it doth grieve me that thy head is here!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: My lord, cheer up your spirits: our foes are nigh,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And this soft courage makes your followers faint.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: You promised knighthood to our forward son:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Unsheathe your sword, and dub him presently.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Edward, kneel down.

line: Edward Plantagenet, arise a knight;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And learn this lesson, draw thy sword in right.

speaker: PRINCE
line: My gracious father, by your kingly leave,

speaker: EDWARD
line: Or bide the mortal fortune of the field?

line: Go, rate thy minions, proud insulting boy!

line: Becomes it thee to be thus bold in terms

line: 'Twas not your valour, Clifford, drove me thence.

line: Northumberland, I hold thee reverently.

speaker: RICHARD
line: Break off the parley; for scarce I can refrain

speaker: RICHARD
line: The execution of my big-swoln heart

line: Upon that Clifford, that cruel child-killer.

line: I slew thy father, call'st thou him a child?

line: Ay, like a dastard and a treacherous coward,

line: But ere sunset I'll make thee curse the deed.

line: Have done with words, my lords, and hear me speak.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Defy them then, or else hold close thy lips.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I prithee, give no limits to my tongue:

speaker: KING HENRY VI

speaker: EDWARD
line: Say, Henry, shall I have my right, or no?

line: That ne'er shall dine unless thou yield the crown.

line: If that be right which Warwick says is right,

line: There is no wrong, but every thing is right.

speaker: RICHARD
line: Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;

line: For, well I wot, thou hast thy mother's tongue.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But like a foul mis-shapen stigmatic,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Mark'd by the destinies to be avoided,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: As venom toads, or lizards' dreadful stings.

speaker: RICHARD

speaker: RICHARD
line: Whose father bears the title of a king,--

speaker: RICHARD
line: As if a channel should be call'd the sea,--

line: Shamest thou not, knowing whence thou art extraught,

speaker: RICHARD
line: To let thy tongue detect thy base-born heart?

speaker: EDWARD
line: A wisp of straw were worth a thousand crowns,

speaker: EDWARD
line: To make this shameless callet know herself.

speaker: EDWARD
line: Helen of Greece was fairer far than thou,

speaker: EDWARD
line: Although thy husband may be Menelaus;

speaker: EDWARD
line: And ne'er was Agamemnon's brother wrong'd

speaker: EDWARD
line: By that false woman, as this king by thee.

speaker: EDWARD
line: His father revell'd in the heart of France,

speaker: EDWARD
line: And tamed the king, and made the dauphin stoop;

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD
line: But when he took a beggar to his bed,

speaker: EDWARD
line: And graced thy poor sire with his bridal-day,

line: For what hath broach'd this tumult but thy pride?

line: Hadst thou been meek, our title still had slept;

speaker: EDWARD

line: We set the axe to thy usurping root;

line: And though the edge hath something hit ourselves,

line: We'll never leave till we have hewn thee down,

speaker: EDWARD

speaker: EDWARD
line: Since thou deniest the gentle king to speak.

speaker: EDWARD
line: And either victory, or else a grave.

speaker: EDWARD

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Till either death hath closed these eyes of mine

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Or fortune given me measure of revenge.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: O Warwick, I do bend my knee with thine;

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And in this vow do chain my soul to thine!

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And, ere my knee rise from the earth's cold face,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: I throw my hands, mine eyes, my heart to thee,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Thou setter up and plucker down of kings,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Beseeching thee, if with they will it stands

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: That to my foes this body must be prey,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Yet that thy brazen gates of heaven may ope,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And give sweet passage to my sinful soul!

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Now, lords, take leave until we meet again,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Where'er it be, in heaven or in earth.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Brother, give me thy hand; and, gentle Warwick,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Let me embrace thee in my weary arms:

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: I, that did never weep, now melt with woe

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: RICHARD
line: That winter should cut off our spring-time so.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Away, away! Once more, sweet lords farewell.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: Yet let us all together to our troops,

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: And give them leave to fly that will not stay;

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: And call them pillars that will stand to us;

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: And, if we thrive, promise them such rewards

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: As victors wear at the Olympian games:

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: This may plant courage in their quailing breasts;

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: For yet is hope of life and victory.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: Forslow no longer, make we hence amain.

scene: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.
speaker: GEORGE
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Now, Clifford, I have singled thee alone:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Suppose this arm is for the Duke of York,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: And this for Rutland; both bound to revenge,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Wert thou environ'd with a brazen wall.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Now, Richard, I am with thee here alone:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: This is the hand that stabb'd thy father York;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And this the hand that slew thy brother Rutland;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And here's the heart that triumphs in their death

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And cheers these hands that slew thy sire and brother

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: To execute the like upon thyself;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And so, have at thee!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Nay Warwick, single out some other chase;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: For I myself will hunt this wolf to death.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: This battle fares like to the morning's war,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When dying clouds contend with growing light,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What time the shepherd, blowing of his nails,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Can neither call it perfect day nor night.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Now sways it this way, like a mighty sea

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Forced by the tide to combat with the wind;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Now sways it that way, like the selfsame sea

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Forced to retire by fury of the wind:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Sometime the flood prevails, and then the wind;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Now one the better, then another best;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Both tugging to be victors, breast to breast,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So is the equal of this fell war.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Here on this molehill will I sit me down.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To whom God will, there be the victory!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For Margaret my queen, and Clifford too,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Have chid me from the battle; swearing both

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: They prosper best of all when I am thence.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For what is in this world but grief and woe?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O God! methinks it were a happy life,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To be no better than a homely swain;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To sit upon a hill, as I do now,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thereby to see the minutes how they run,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How many make the hour full complete;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How many hours bring about the day;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How many days will finish up the year;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How many years a mortal man may live.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When this is known, then to divide the times:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many hours must I tend my flock;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many hours must I take my rest;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many hours must I contemplate;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many hours must I sport myself;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many days my ewes have been with young;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Pass'd over to the end they were created,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is far beyond a prince's delicates,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: His viands sparkling in a golden cup,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: His body couched in a curious bed,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: May be possessed with some store of crowns;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: And I, that haply take them from him now,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: May yet ere night yield both my life and them

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: To some man else, as this dead man doth me.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: O heavy times, begetting such events!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: From London by the king was I press'd forth;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Came on the part of York, press'd by his master;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: And I, who at his hands received my life, him

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Have by my hands of life bereaved him.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: For I have bought it with an hundred blows.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: But let me see: is this our foeman's face?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Ah, no, no, no, it is mine only son!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Throw up thine eye! see, see what showers arise,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: O, pity, God, this miserable age!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Erroneous, mutinous and unnatural,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: This deadly quarrel daily doth beget!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: And hath bereft thee of thy life too late!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O that my death would stay these ruthful deeds!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The red rose and the white are on his face,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The fatal colours of our striving houses:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The one his purple blood right well resembles;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The other his pale cheeks, methinks, presenteth:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Wither one rose, and let the other flourish;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If you contend, a thousand lives must wither.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: How will my mother for a father's death

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Take on with me and ne'er be satisfied!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: How will my wife for slaughter of my son

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Shed seas of tears and ne'er be satisfied!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How will the country for these woful chances

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Misthink the king and not be satisfied!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: Was ever son so rued a father's death?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Was ever father so bemoan'd his son?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Was ever king so grieved for subjects' woe?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Much is your sorrow; mine ten times so much.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Son
line: I'll bear thee hence, where I may weep my fill.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: These arms of mine shall be thy winding-sheet;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: My heart, sweet boy, shall be thy sepulchre,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: For from my heart thine image ne'er shall go;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: My sighing breast shall be thy funeral bell;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: And so obsequious will thy father be,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: Even for the loss of thee, having no more,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: As Priam was for all his valiant sons.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: I'll bear thee hence; and let them fight that will,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: Father
line: For I have murdered where I should not kill.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Sad-hearted men, much overgone with care,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Here sits a king more woful than you are.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Fly, father, fly! for all your friends are fled,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: And Warwick rages like a chafed bull:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Away! for death doth hold us in pursuit.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Mount you, my lord; towards Berwick post amain:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Edward and Richard, like a brace of greyhounds

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Having the fearful flying hare in sight,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With fiery eyes sparkling for very wrath,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And bloody steel grasp'd in their ireful hands,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Are at our backs; and therefore hence amain.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EXETER
line: Away! for vengeance comes along with them:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EXETER
line: Nay, stay not to expostulate, make speed;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EXETER
line: Or else come after: I'll away before.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Nay, take me with thee, good sweet Exeter:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Not that I fear to stay, but love to go

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whither the queen intends. Forward; away!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Here burns my candle out; ay, here it dies,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Which, whiles it lasted, gave King Henry light.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: O Lancaster, I fear thy overthrow

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: More than my body's parting with my soul!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: My love and fear glued many friends to thee;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And, now I fall, thy tough commixture melts.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Impairing Henry, strengthening misproud York,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: The common people swarm like summer flies;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And whither fly the gnats but to the sun?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And who shines now but Henry's enemies?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: O Phoebus, hadst thou never given consent

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: That Phaethon should cheque thy fiery steeds,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Thy burning car never had scorch'd the earth!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And, Henry, hadst thou sway'd as kings should do,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Or as thy father and his father did,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Giving no ground unto the house of York,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: They never then had sprung like summer flies;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: I and ten thousand in this luckless realm

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Had left no mourning widows for our death;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And thou this day hadst kept thy chair in peace.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: For what doth cherish weeds but gentle air?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And what makes robbers bold but too much lenity?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Bootless are plaints, and cureless are my wounds;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: No way to fly, nor strength to hold out flight:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: The foe is merciless, and will not pity;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: For at their hands I have deserved no pity.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: The air hath got into my deadly wounds,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And much effuse of blood doth make me faint.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Come, York and Richard, Warwick and the rest;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: I stabb'd your fathers' bosoms, split my breast.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Now breathe we, lords: good fortune bids us pause,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And smooth the frowns of war with peaceful looks.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Some troops pursue the bloody-minded queen,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: That led calm Henry, though he were a king,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: As doth a sail, fill'd with a fretting gust,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Command an argosy to stem the waves.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: But think you, lords, that Clifford fled with them?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: No, 'tis impossible he should escape,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For, though before his face I speak the words

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Your brother Richard mark'd him for the grave:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And wheresoe'er he is, he's surely dead.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Whose soul is that which takes her heavy leave?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: A deadly groan, like life and death's departing.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: See who it is: and, now the battle's ended,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: If friend or foe, let him be gently used.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Revoke that doom of mercy, for 'tis Clifford;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Who not contented that he lopp'd the branch

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: In hewing Rutland when his leaves put forth,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: But set his murdering knife unto the root

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: From whence that tender spray did sweetly spring,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: I mean our princely father, Duke of York.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: From off the gates of York fetch down the head,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Your father's head, which Clifford placed there;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Instead whereof let this supply the room:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Measure for measure must be answered.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Bring forth that fatal screech-owl to our house,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: That nothing sung but death to us and ours:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Now death shall stop his dismal threatening sound,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And his ill-boding tongue no more shall speak.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I think his understanding is bereft.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Speak, Clifford, dost thou know who speaks to thee?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Dark cloudy death o'ershades his beams of life,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And he nor sees nor hears us what we say.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: O, would he did! and so perhaps he doth:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: 'Tis but his policy to counterfeit,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Because he would avoid such bitter taunts

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Which in the time of death he gave our father.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GEORGE
line: If so thou think'st, vex him with eager words.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Clifford, ask mercy and obtain no grace.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Clifford, repent in bootless penitence.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Clifford, devise excuses for thy faults.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GEORGE
line: While we devise fell tortures for thy faults.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Thou didst love York, and I am son to York.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Thou pitied'st Rutland; I will pity thee.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GEORGE
line: Where's Captain Margaret, to fence you now?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: They mock thee, Clifford: swear as thou wast wont.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: What, not an oath? nay, then the world goes hard

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: When Clifford cannot spare his friends an oath.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: I know by that he's dead; and, by my soul,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: If this right hand would buy two hour's life,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: That I in all despite might rail at him,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: This hand should chop it off, and with the

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: issuing blood

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Stifle the villain whose unstanched thirst

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: York and young Rutland could not satisfy.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Ay, but he's dead: off with the traitor's head,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And rear it in the place your father's stands.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And now to London with triumphant march,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: There to be crowned England's royal king:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: From whence shall Warwick cut the sea to France,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And ask the Lady Bona for thy queen:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: So shalt thou sinew both these lands together;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And, having France thy friend, thou shalt not dread

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The scatter'd foe that hopes to rise again;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For though they cannot greatly sting to hurt,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Yet look to have them buzz to offend thine ears.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: First will I see the coronation;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And then to Brittany I'll cross the sea,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To effect this marriage, so it please my lord.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Even as thou wilt, sweet Warwick, let it be;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: For in thy shoulder do I build my seat,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And never will I undertake the thing

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Wherein thy counsel and consent is wanting.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Richard, I will create thee Duke of Gloucester,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: And George, of Clarence: Warwick, as ourself,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EDWARD
line: Shall do and undo as him pleaseth best.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: Let me be Duke of Clarence, George of Gloucester;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: RICHARD
line: For Gloucester's dukedom is too ominous.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Tut, that's a foolish observation:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Richard, be Duke of Gloucester. Now to London,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To see these honours in possession.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WARWICK
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Under this thick-grown brake we'll shroud ourselves;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: For through this laund anon the deer will come;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: And in this covert will we make our stand,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Culling the principal of all the deer.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: I'll stay above the hill, so both may shoot.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: That cannot be; the noise of thy cross-bow

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Will scare the herd, and so my shoot is lost.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Here stand we both, and aim we at the best:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: And, for the time shall not seem tedious,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: I'll tell thee what befell me on a day

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: In this self-place where now we mean to stand.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Here comes a man; let's stay till he be past.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: From Scotland am I stol'n, even of pure love,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: No, Harry, Harry, 'tis no land of thine;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thy place is fill'd, thy sceptre wrung from thee,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thy balm wash'd off wherewith thou wast anointed:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: No bending knee will call thee Caesar now,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: No humble suitors press to speak for right,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: No, not a man comes for redress of thee;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For how can I help them, and not myself?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Ay, here's a deer whose skin's a keeper's fee:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: This is the quondam king; let's seize upon him.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For wise men say it is the wisest course.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Why linger we? let us lay hands upon him.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: Forbear awhile; we'll hear a little more.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My queen and son are gone to France for aid;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, as I hear, the great commanding Warwick

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is thither gone, to crave the French king's sister

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To wife for Edward: if this news be true,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Poor queen and son, your labour is but lost;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For Warwick is a subtle orator,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And Lewis a prince soon won with moving words.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: By this account then Margaret may win him;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For she's a woman to be pitied much:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Her sighs will make a battery in his breast;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Her tears will pierce into a marble heart;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The tiger will be mild whiles she doth mourn;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And Nero will be tainted with remorse,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To hear and see her plaints, her brinish tears.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ay, but she's come to beg, Warwick to give;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: She, on his left side, craving aid for Henry,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: He, on his right, asking a wife for Edward.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: She weeps, and says her Henry is deposed;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: He smiles, and says his Edward is install'd;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That she, poor wretch, for grief can speak no more;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whiles Warwick tells his title, smooths the wrong,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Inferreth arguments of mighty strength,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And in conclusion wins the king from her,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With promise of his sister, and what else,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To strengthen and support King Edward's place.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O Margaret, thus 'twill be; and thou, poor soul,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Art then forsaken, as thou went'st forlorn!

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Say, what art thou that talk'st of kings and queens?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: More than I seem, and less than I was born to:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: A man at least, for less I should not be;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And men may talk of kings, and why not I?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Ay, but thou talk'st as if thou wert a king.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, so I am, in mind; and that's enough.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: But, if thou be a king, where is thy crown?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My crown is in my heart, not on my head;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Not decked with diamonds and Indian stones,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Nor to be seen: my crown is called content:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: A crown it is that seldom kings enjoy.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Well, if you be a king crown'd with content,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Your crown content and you must be contented

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: To go along with us; for as we think,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: You are the king King Edward hath deposed;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: And we his subjects sworn in all allegiance

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Will apprehend you as his enemy.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But did you never swear, and break an oath?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: No, never such an oath; nor will not now.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Where did you dwell when I was King of England?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: Second Keeper
line: Here in this country, where we now remain.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I was anointed king at nine months old;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My father and my grandfather were kings,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And you were sworn true subjects unto me:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And tell me, then, have you not broke your oaths?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: No;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: For we were subjects but while you were king.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, am I dead? do I not breathe a man?

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, simple men, you know not what you swear!

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Look, as I blow this feather from my face,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And as the air blows it to me again,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Obeying with my wind when I do blow,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And yielding to another when it blows,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Commanded always by the greater gust;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Such is the lightness of you common men.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But do not break your oaths; for of that sin

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My mild entreaty shall not make you guilty.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go where you will, the king shall be commanded;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And be you kings, command, and I'll obey.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: We are true subjects to the king, King Edward.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So would you be again to Henry,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If he were seated as King Edward is.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: We charge you, in God's name, and the king's,

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: First Keeper
line: To go with us unto the officers.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: In God's name, lead; your king's name be obey'd:

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And what God will, that let your king perform;

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And what he will, I humbly yield unto.

scene: SCENE I.  A forest in the north of England.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Brother of Gloucester, at Saint Alban's field

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: This lady's husband, Sir Richard Grey, was slain,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: His lands then seized on by the conqueror:

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Her suit is now to repossess those lands;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Which we in justice cannot well deny,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Because in quarrel of the house of York

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: The worthy gentleman did lose his life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Your highness shall do well to grant her suit;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: It were dishonour to deny it her.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: It were no less; but yet I'll make a pause.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  Yea, is it so?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I see the lady hath a thing to grant,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Before the king will grant her humble suit.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  He knows the game: how true

speaker: CLARENCE
line: he keeps the wind!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  Silence!

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Widow, we will consider of your suit;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And come some other time to know our mind.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Right gracious lord, I cannot brook delay:

speaker: LADY GREY
line: May it please your highness to resolve me now;

speaker: LADY GREY
line: And what your pleasure is, shall satisfy me.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  Ay, widow? then I'll warrant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: you all your lands,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: An if what pleases him shall pleasure you.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Fight closer, or, good faith, you'll catch a blow.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  I fear her not, unless she

speaker: CLARENCE
line: chance to fall.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE God forbid that! for he'll

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: take vantages.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: How many children hast thou, widow? tell me.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  I think he means to beg a

speaker: CLARENCE
line: child of her.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  Nay, whip me then: he'll rather

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: give her two.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Three, my most gracious lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  You shall have four, if you'll

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: be ruled by him.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: 'Twere pity they should lose their father's lands.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Be pitiful, dread lord, and grant it then.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Lords, give us leave: I'll try this widow's wit.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  Ay, good leave have you; for

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: you will have leave,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Till youth take leave and leave you to the crutch.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Now tell me, madam, do you love your children?

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Ay, full as dearly as I love myself.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And would you not do much to do them good?

speaker: LADY GREY
line: To do them good, I would sustain some harm.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Then get your husband's lands, to do them good.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Therefore I came unto your majesty.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: I'll tell you how these lands are to be got.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: So shall you bind me to your highness' service.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: What service wilt thou do me, if I give them?

speaker: LADY GREY
line: What you command, that rests in me to do.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: But you will take exceptions to my boon.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: No, gracious lord, except I cannot do it.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Ay, but thou canst do what I mean to ask.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Why, then I will do what your grace commands.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  He plies her hard; and much rain

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: wears the marble.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  As red as fire! nay, then

speaker: CLARENCE
line: her wax must melt.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Why stops my lord, shall I not hear my task?

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: An easy task; 'tis but to love a king.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: That's soon perform'd, because I am a subject.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Why, then, thy husband's lands I freely give thee.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: I take my leave with many thousand thanks.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  The match is made; she seals it

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: with a curtsy.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: But stay thee, 'tis the fruits of love I mean.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: The fruits of love I mean, my loving liege.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Ay, but, I fear me, in another sense.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: What love, think'st thou, I sue so much to get?

speaker: LADY GREY
line: My love till death, my humble thanks, my prayers;

speaker: LADY GREY
line: That love which virtue begs and virtue grants.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: No, by my troth, I did not mean such love.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Why, then you mean not as I thought you did.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: But now you partly may perceive my mind.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: My mind will never grant what I perceive

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Your highness aims at, if I aim aright.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: To tell thee plain, I aim to lie with thee.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: To tell you plain, I had rather lie in prison.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Why, then thou shalt not have thy husband's lands.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Why, then mine honesty shall be my dower;

speaker: LADY GREY
line: For by that loss I will not purchase them.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Therein thou wrong'st thy children mightily.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Herein your highness wrongs both them and me.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: But, mighty lord, this merry inclination

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Accords not with the sadness of my suit:

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Please you dismiss me either with 'ay' or 'no.'

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Ay, if thou wilt say 'ay' to my request;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: No if thou dost say 'no' to my demand.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: Then, no, my lord. My suit is at an end.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
