line: Aside to CLARENCE  The widow likes him not, she

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: knits her brows.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  He is the bluntest wooer in

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Christendom.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Aside  Her looks do argue her replete with modesty;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Her words do show her wit incomparable;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: All her perfections challenge sovereignty:

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: One way or other, she is for a king;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And she shall be my love, or else my queen.--

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Say that King Edward take thee for his queen?

speaker: LADY GREY
line: 'Tis better said than done, my gracious lord:

speaker: LADY GREY
line: I am a subject fit to jest withal,

speaker: LADY GREY
line: But far unfit to be a sovereign.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Sweet widow, by my state I swear to thee

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: I speak no more than what my soul intends;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And that is, to enjoy thee for my love.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: And that is more than I will yield unto:

speaker: LADY GREY
line: I know I am too mean to be your queen,

speaker: LADY GREY
line: And yet too good to be your concubine.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: You cavil, widow: I did mean, my queen.

speaker: LADY GREY
line: 'Twill grieve your grace my sons should call you father.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: No more than when my daughters call thee mother.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Thou art a widow, and thou hast some children;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And, by God's mother, I, being but a bachelor,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Have other some: why, 'tis a happy thing

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: To be the father unto many sons.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Answer no more, for thou shalt be my queen.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside to CLARENCE  The ghostly father now hath done

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: his shrift.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Aside to GLOUCESTER  When he was made a shriver,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: 'twas for shift.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Brothers, you muse what chat we two have had.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The widow likes it not, for she looks very sad.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: You'll think it strange if I should marry her.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: To whom, my lord?

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Why, Clarence, to myself.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That would be ten days' wonder at the least.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: That's a day longer than a wonder lasts.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: By so much is the wonder in extremes.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Well, jest on, brothers: I can tell you both

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Her suit is granted for her husband's lands.

speaker: Nobleman
line: My gracious lord, Henry your foe is taken,

speaker: Nobleman
line: And brought your prisoner to your palace gate.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: See that he be convey'd unto the Tower:

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And go we, brothers, to the man that took him,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: To question of his apprehension.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Widow, go you along. Lords, use her honourably.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, Edward will use women honourably.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Would he were wasted, marrow, bones and all,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That from his loins no hopeful branch may spring,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To cross me from the golden time I look for!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And yet, between my soul's desire and me--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The lustful Edward's title buried--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Is Clarence, Henry, and his son young Edward,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And all the unlook'd for issue of their bodies,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To take their rooms, ere I can place myself:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: A cold premeditation for my purpose!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, then, I do but dream on sovereignty;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Like one that stands upon a promontory,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And spies a far-off shore where he would tread,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Wishing his foot were equal with his eye,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And chides the sea that sunders him from thence,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Saying, he'll lade it dry to have his way:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: So do I wish the crown, being so far off;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And so I chide the means that keeps me from it;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And so I say, I'll cut the causes off,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Flattering me with impossibilities.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My eye's too quick, my heart o'erweens too much,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Unless my hand and strength could equal them.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Well, say there is no kingdom then for Richard;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: What other pleasure can the world afford?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll make my heaven in a lady's lap,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And deck my body in gay ornaments,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And witch sweet ladies with my words and looks.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: O miserable thought! and more unlikely

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Than to accomplish twenty golden crowns!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, love forswore me in my mother's womb:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And, for I should not deal in her soft laws,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: She did corrupt frail nature with some bribe,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To shrink mine arm up like a wither'd shrub;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To make an envious mountain on my back,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Where sits deformity to mock my body;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To shape my legs of an unequal size;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To disproportion me in every part,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Like to a chaos, or an unlick'd bear-whelp

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That carries no impression like the dam.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And am I then a man to be beloved?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: O monstrous fault, to harbour such a thought!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Then, since this earth affords no joy to me,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But to command, to cheque, to o'erbear such

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: As are of better person than myself,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll make my heaven to dream upon the crown,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And, whiles I live, to account this world but hell,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Until my mis-shaped trunk that bears this head

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Be round impaled with a glorious crown.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And yet I know not how to get the crown,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For many lives stand between me and home:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And I,--like one lost in a thorny wood,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That rends the thorns and is rent with the thorns,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Seeking a way and straying from the way;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Not knowing how to find the open air,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But toiling desperately to find it out,--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Torment myself to catch the English crown:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And from that torment I will free myself,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Or hew my way out with a bloody axe.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, I can smile, and murder whiles I smile,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And cry 'Content' to that which grieves my heart,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And wet my cheeks with artificial tears,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And frame my face to all occasions.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll drown more sailors than the mermaid shall;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll slay more gazers than the basilisk;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll play the orator as well as Nestor,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Deceive more slily than Ulysses could,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And, like a Sinon, take another Troy.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I can add colours to the chameleon,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Change shapes with Proteus for advantages,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And set the murderous Machiavel to school.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Can I do this, and cannot get a crown?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Tut, were it farther off, I'll pluck it down.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Fair Queen of England, worthy Margaret,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Sit down with us: it ill befits thy state

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And birth, that thou shouldst stand while Lewis doth sit.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: No, mighty King of France: now Margaret

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Must strike her sail and learn awhile to serve

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Where kings command. I was, I must confess,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Great Albion's queen in former golden days:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But now mischance hath trod my title down,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And with dishonour laid me on the ground;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Where I must take like seat unto my fortune,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And to my humble seat conform myself.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Why, say, fair queen, whence springs this deep despair?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: From such a cause as fills mine eyes with tears

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And stops my tongue, while heart is drown'd in cares.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Whate'er it be, be thou still like thyself,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And sit thee by our side:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Yield not thy neck

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: To fortune's yoke, but let thy dauntless mind

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Still ride in triumph over all mischance.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Be plain, Queen Margaret, and tell thy grief;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: It shall be eased, if France can yield relief.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Those gracious words revive my drooping thoughts

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And give my tongue-tied sorrows leave to speak.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Now, therefore, be it known to noble Lewis,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That Henry, sole possessor of my love,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Is of a king become a banish'd man,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And forced to live in Scotland a forlorn;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: While proud ambitious Edward Duke of York

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Usurps the regal title and the seat

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Of England's true-anointed lawful king.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: This is the cause that I, poor Margaret,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With this my son, Prince Edward, Henry's heir,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Am come to crave thy just and lawful aid;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And if thou fail us, all our hope is done:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Scotland hath will to help, but cannot help;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Our people and our peers are both misled,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Our treasures seized, our soldiers put to flight,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And, as thou seest, ourselves in heavy plight.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Renowned queen, with patience calm the storm,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: While we bethink a means to break it off.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The more we stay, the stronger grows our foe.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: The more I stay, the more I'll succor thee.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O, but impatience waiteth on true sorrow.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And see where comes the breeder of my sorrow!

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: What's he approacheth boldly to our presence?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Our Earl of Warwick, Edward's greatest friend.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Welcome, brave Warwick! What brings thee to France?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ay, now begins a second storm to rise;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For this is he that moves both wind and tide.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: From worthy Edward, King of Albion,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: My lord and sovereign, and thy vowed friend,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I come, in kindness and unfeigned love,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: First, to do greetings to thy royal person;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And then to crave a league of amity;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And lastly, to confirm that amity

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With a nuptial knot, if thou vouchsafe to grant

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That virtuous Lady Bona, thy fair sister,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To England's king in lawful marriage.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Aside  If that go forward, Henry's hope is done.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To BONA  And, gracious madam, in our king's behalf,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I am commanded, with your leave and favour,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Humbly to kiss your hand, and with my tongue

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To tell the passion of my sovereign's heart;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Where fame, late entering at his heedful ears,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Hath placed thy beauty's image and thy virtue.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: King Lewis and Lady Bona, hear me speak,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Before you answer Warwick. His demand

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Springs not from Edward's well-meant honest love,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But from deceit bred by necessity;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For how can tyrants safely govern home,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Unless abroad they purchase great alliance?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To prove him tyrant this reason may suffice,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That Henry liveth still: but were he dead,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yet here Prince Edward stands, King Henry's son.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Look, therefore, Lewis, that by this league and marriage

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Thou draw not on thy danger and dishonour;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For though usurpers sway the rule awhile,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yet heavens are just, and time suppresseth wrongs.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Injurious Margaret!

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: And why not queen?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Because thy father Henry did usurp;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And thou no more are prince than she is queen.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Then Warwick disannuls great John of Gaunt,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Which did subdue the greatest part of Spain;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: And, after John of Gaunt, Henry the Fourth,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Whose wisdom was a mirror to the wisest;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: And, after that wise prince, Henry the Fifth,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Who by his prowess conquered all France:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: From these our Henry lineally descends.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Oxford, how haps it, in this smooth discourse,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: You told not how Henry the Sixth hath lost

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: All that which Henry Fifth had gotten?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Methinks these peers of France should smile at that.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But for the rest, you tell a pedigree

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Of threescore and two years; a silly time

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To make prescription for a kingdom's worth.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Why, Warwick, canst thou speak against thy liege,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Whom thou obeyed'st thirty and six years,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: And not bewray thy treason with a blush?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Can Oxford, that did ever fence the right,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Now buckler falsehood with a pedigree?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For shame! leave Henry, and call Edward king.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Call him my king by whose injurious doom

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: My elder brother, the Lord Aubrey Vere,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Was done to death? and more than so, my father,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Even in the downfall of his mellow'd years,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: When nature brought him to the door of death?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: No, Warwick, no; while life upholds this arm,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: This arm upholds the house of Lancaster.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And I the house of York.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Queen Margaret, Prince Edward, and Oxford,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Vouchsafe, at our request, to stand aside,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: While I use further conference with Warwick.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Heavens grant that Warwick's words bewitch him not!

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Now Warwick, tell me, even upon thy conscience,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Is Edward your true king? for I were loath

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: To link with him that were not lawful chosen.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Thereon I pawn my credit and mine honour.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: But is he gracious in the people's eye?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The more that Henry was unfortunate.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Then further, all dissembling set aside,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Tell me for truth the measure of his love

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Unto our sister Bona.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Such it seems

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: As may beseem a monarch like himself.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Myself have often heard him say and swear

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That this his love was an eternal plant,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Whereof the root was fix'd in virtue's ground,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The leaves and fruit maintain'd with beauty's sun,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Exempt from envy, but not from disdain,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Unless the Lady Bona quit his pain.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Now, sister, let us hear your firm resolve.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: Your grant, or your denial, shall be mine:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: Yet I confess that often ere this day,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: When I have heard your king's desert recounted,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: Mine ear hath tempted judgment to desire.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Then, Warwick, thus: our sister shall be Edward's;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And now forthwith shall articles be drawn

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Touching the jointure that your king must make,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Which with her dowry shall be counterpoised.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Draw near, Queen Margaret, and be a witness

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: That Bona shall be wife to the English king.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: To Edward, but not to the English king.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Deceitful Warwick! it was thy device

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: By this alliance to make void my suit:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Before thy coming Lewis was Henry's friend.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And still is friend to him and Margaret:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: But if your title to the crown be weak,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: As may appear by Edward's good success,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Then 'tis but reason that I be released

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: From giving aid which late I promised.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Yet shall you have all kindness at my hand

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: That your estate requires and mine can yield.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Henry now lives in Scotland at his ease,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Where having nothing, nothing can he lose.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And as for you yourself, our quondam queen,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: You have a father able to maintain you;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And better 'twere you troubled him than France.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Peace, impudent and shameless Warwick, peace,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Proud setter up and puller down of kings!

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I will not hence, till, with my talk and tears,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Both full of truth, I make King Lewis behold

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Thy sly conveyance and thy lord's false love;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For both of you are birds of selfsame feather.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Warwick, this is some post to us or thee.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: Post
line: To WARWICK  My lord ambassador, these letters are for you,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: Post
line: Sent from your brother, Marquess Montague:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: Post
line: These from our king unto your majesty:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: Post
line: And, madam, these for you; from whom I know not.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: I like it well that our fair queen and mistress

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: OXFORD
line: Smiles at her news, while Warwick frowns at his.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Nay, mark how Lewis stamps, as he were nettled:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: I hope all's for the best.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Warwick, what are thy news? and yours, fair queen?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Mine, such as fill my heart with unhoped joys.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Mine, full of sorrow and heart's discontent.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: What! has your king married the Lady Grey!

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And now, to soothe your forgery and his,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Sends me a paper to persuade me patience?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Is this the alliance that he seeks with France?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Dare he presume to scorn us in this manner?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I told your majesty as much before:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: This proveth Edward's love and Warwick's honesty.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: King Lewis, I here protest, in sight of heaven,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And by the hope I have of heavenly bliss,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That I am clear from this misdeed of Edward's,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: No more my king, for he dishonours me,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But most himself, if he could see his shame.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Did I forget that by the house of York

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: My father came untimely to his death?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Did I let pass the abuse done to my niece?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Did I impale him with the regal crown?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Did I put Henry from his native right?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And am I guerdon'd at the last with shame?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Shame on himself! for my desert is honour:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And to repair my honour lost for him,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I here renounce him and return to Henry.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: My noble queen, let former grudges pass,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And henceforth I am thy true servitor:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I will revenge his wrong to Lady Bona,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And replant Henry in his former state.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Warwick, these words have turn'd my hate to love;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And I forgive and quite forget old faults,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And joy that thou becomest King Henry's friend.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: So much his friend, ay, his unfeigned friend,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That, if King Lewis vouchsafe to furnish us

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With some few bands of chosen soldiers,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I'll undertake to land them on our coast

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And force the tyrant from his seat by war.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: 'Tis not his new-made bride shall succor him:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And as for Clarence, as my letters tell me,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: He's very likely now to fall from him,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For matching more for wanton lust than honour,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Or than for strength and safety of our country.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: Dear brother, how shall Bona be revenged

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: But by thy help to this distressed queen?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Renowned prince, how shall poor Henry live,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Unless thou rescue him from foul despair?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: My quarrel and this English queen's are one.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And mine, fair lady Bona, joins with yours.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And mine with hers, and thine, and Margaret's.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Therefore at last I firmly am resolved

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: You shall have aid.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Let me give humble thanks for all at once.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Then, England's messenger, return in post,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And tell false Edward, thy supposed king,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: That Lewis of France is sending over masquers

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: To revel it with him and his new bride:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Thou seest what's past, go fear thy king withal.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: BONA
line: I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Tell him, my mourning weeds are laid aside,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And I am ready to put armour on.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: There's thy reward: be gone.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: But, Warwick,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Thou and Oxford, with five thousand men,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Shall cross the seas, and bid false Edward battle;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And, as occasion serves, this noble queen

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And prince shall follow with a fresh supply.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Yet, ere thou go, but answer me one doubt,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: What pledge have we of thy firm loyalty?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: This shall assure my constant loyalty,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That if our queen and this young prince agree,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I'll join mine eldest daughter and my joy

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To him forthwith in holy wedlock bands.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yes, I agree, and thank you for your motion.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Son Edward, she is fair and virtuous,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Therefore delay not, give thy hand to Warwick;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And, with thy hand, thy faith irrevocable,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That only Warwick's daughter shall be thine.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Yes, I accept her, for she well deserves it;

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: And here, to pledge my vow, I give my hand.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Why stay we now? These soldiers shall be levied,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: And thou, Lord Bourbon, our high admiral,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: Shalt waft them over with our royal fleet.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: I long till Edward fall by war's mischance,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: KING LEWIS XI
line: For mocking marriage with a dame of France.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I came from Edward as ambassador,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But I return his sworn and mortal foe:

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Matter of marriage was the charge he gave me,

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But dreadful war shall answer his demand.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Had he none else to make a stale but me?

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Then none but I shall turn his jest to sorrow.

scene: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced,

speaker: WARWICK
line: That we could hear no news of his repair?

line: Now, Warwick, wilt thou ope the city gates,

line: Speak gentle words and humbly bend thy knee,

line: Call Edward king and at his hands beg mercy?

speaker: WARWICK
line: Confess who set thee up and pluck'd thee own,

line: Call Warwick patron and be penitent?

line: Or did he make the jest against his will?

line: Is not a dukedom, sir, a goodly gift?

line: Ay, by my faith, for a poor earl to give:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll do thee service for so good a gift.

speaker: WARWICK
line: 'Twas I that gave the kingdom to thy brother.

line: Why then 'tis mine, if but by Warwick's gift.

line: Thou art no Atlas for so great a weight:

line: And weakling, Warwick takes his gift again;

speaker: WARWICK
line: And Henry is my king, Warwick his subject.

line: But Warwick's king is Edward's prisoner:

line: And, gallant Warwick, do but answer this:

line: What is the body when the head is off?

line: Alas, that Warwick had no more forecast,

line: But, whiles he thought to steal the single ten,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The king was slily finger'd from the deck!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: You left poor Henry at the Bishop's palace,

line: And, ten to one, you'll meet him in the Tower.

speaker: EDWARD
line: 'Tis even so; yet you are Warwick still.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Come, Warwick, take the time; kneel down, kneel down:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Nay, when? strike now, or else the iron cools.

line: And with the other fling it at thy face,

line: Shall, whiles thy head is warm and new cut off,

line: Write in the dust this sentence with thy blood,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV

line: O cheerful colours! see where Oxford comes!

line: The gates are open, let us enter too.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: So other foes may set upon our backs.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Stand we in good array; for they no doubt

line: Will issue out again and bid us battle:

line: If not, the city being but of small defence,

line: We'll quickly rouse the traitors in the same.

line: O, welcome, Oxford! for we want thy help.

speaker: MONTAGUE
line: Montague, Montague, for Lancaster!

line: Even with the dearest blood your bodies bear.

line: The harder match'd, the greater victory:

line: Somerset, Somerset, for Lancaster!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Two of thy name, both Dukes of Somerset,

line: Have sold their lives unto the house of York;

line: And thou shalt be the third if this sword hold.

speaker: WARWICK
line: And lo, where George of Clarence sweeps along,

speaker: WARWICK
line: Of force enough to bid his brother battle;

speaker: WARWICK
line: With whom an upright zeal to right prevails

speaker: WARWICK
line: More than the nature of a brother's love!

line: Come, Clarence, come; thou wilt, if Warwick call.

line: Father of Warwick, know you what this means?

line: Look here, I throw my infamy at thee

speaker: CLARENCE
line: I will not ruinate my father's house,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: And set up Lancaster. Why, trow'st thou, Warwick,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: That Clarence is so harsh, so blunt, unnatural,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: To bend the fatal instruments of war

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Against his brother and his lawful king?

line: Perhaps thou wilt object my holy oath:

speaker: CLARENCE
line: To keep that oath were more impiety

speaker: CLARENCE
line: I am so sorry for my trespass made

line: I here proclaim myself thy mortal foe,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--

speaker: CLARENCE
line: As I will meet thee, if thou stir abroad--

speaker: CLARENCE
line: To plague thee for thy foul misleading me.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: And so, proud-hearted Warwick, I defy thee,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: And to my brother turn my blushing cheeks.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And all the trouble thou hast turn'd me to?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Suppose that I am now my father's mouth;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That you might still have worn the petticoat,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And ne'er have stol'n the breech from Lancaster.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Let AEsop fable in a winter's night;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: His currish riddles sort not with this place.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: By heaven, brat, I'll plague ye for that word.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For God's sake, take away this captive scold.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: Untutor'd lad, thou art too malapert.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: I know my duty; you are all undutiful:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: And thou mis-shapen Dick, I tell ye all

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: I am your better, traitors as ye are:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE EDWARD
line: And thou usurp'st my father's right and mine.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sprawl'st thou? take that, to end thy agony.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: And there's for twitting me with perjury.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O, kill me too!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Marry, and shall.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Hold, Richard, hold; for we have done too much.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why should she live, to fill the world with words?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: What, doth she swoon? use means for her recovery.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll hence to London on a serious matter:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: What? what?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The Tower, the Tower.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Canst thou not speak? O traitors! murderers!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: They that stabb'd Caesar shed no blood at all,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: If this foul deed were by to equal it:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: He was a man; this, in respect, a child:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And men ne'er spend their fury on a child.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What's worse than murderer, that I may name it?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And I will speak, that so my heart may burst.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: How sweet a plant have you untimely cropp'd!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: You have no children, butchers! if you had,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The thought of them would have stirr'd up remorse:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But if you ever chance to have a child,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Look in his youth to have him so cut off

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Here sheathe thy sword, I'll pardon thee my death:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What, wilt thou not? then, Clarence, do it thou.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Good Clarence, do; sweet Clarence, do thou do it.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: 'Twas sin before, but now 'tis charity.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What, wilt thou not? Where is that devil's butcher,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Hard-favour'd Richard? Richard, where art thou?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Thou art not here: murder is thy alms-deed;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Petitioners for blood thou ne'er put'st back.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Away, I say; I charge ye, bear her hence.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Where's Richard gone?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: To London, all in post; and, as I guess,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: CLARENCE
line: To make a bloody supper in the Tower.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: He's sudden, if a thing comes in his head.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Now march we hence: discharge the common sort

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: With pay and thanks, and let's away to London

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And see our gentle queen how well she fares:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Good day, my lord. What, at your book so hard?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ay, my good lord:--my lord, I should say rather;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: 'Tis sin to flatter; 'good' was little better:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: 'Good Gloucester' and 'good devil' were alike,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And both preposterous; therefore, not 'good lord.'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sirrah, leave us to ourselves: we must confer.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So flies the reckless shepherd from the wolf;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So first the harmless sheep doth yield his fleece

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And next his throat unto the butcher's knife.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What scene of death hath Roscius now to act?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The thief doth fear each bush an officer.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The bird that hath been limed in a bush,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And I, the hapless male to one sweet bird,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Have now the fatal object in my eye

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That taught his son the office of a fowl!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The sun that sear'd the wings of my sweet boy

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thy brother Edward, and thyself the sea

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, kill me with thy weapon, not with words!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My breast can better brook thy dagger's point

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than can my ears that tragic history.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But wherefore dost thou come? is't for my life?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Think'st thou I am an executioner?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: A persecutor, I am sure, thou art:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If murdering innocents be executing,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, then thou art an executioner.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Thy son I kill'd for his presumption.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Hadst thou been kill'd when first thou didst presume,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thou hadst not lived to kill a son of mine.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And thus I prophesy, that many a thousand,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And many an old man's sigh and many a widow's,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And many an orphan's water-standing eye--

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Men for their sons, wives for their husbands,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And orphans for their parents timeless death--

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Shall rue the hour that ever thou wast born.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The owl shriek'd at thy birth,--an evil sign;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The night-crow cried, aboding luckless time;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Dogs howl'd, and hideous tempest shook down trees;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The raven rook'd her on the chimney's top,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And chattering pies in dismal discords sung.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thy mother felt more than a mother's pain,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, yet brought forth less than a mother's hope,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To wit, an indigested and deformed lump,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Not like the fruit of such a goodly tree.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Teeth hadst thou in thy head when thou wast born,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To signify thou camest to bite the world:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, if the rest be true which I have heard,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thou camest--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll hear no more: die, prophet in thy speech:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For this amongst the rest, was I ordain'd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ay, and for much more slaughter after this.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: God forgive my sins, and pardon thee!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: What, will the aspiring blood of Lancaster

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sink in the ground? I thought it would have mounted.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: See how my sword weeps for the poor king's death!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: O, may such purple tears be alway shed

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: From those that wish the downfall of our house!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: If any spark of life be yet remaining,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Down, down to hell; and say I sent thee thither:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I, that have neither pity, love, nor fear.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Indeed, 'tis true that Henry told me of;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For I have often heard my mother say

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I came into the world with my legs forward:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Had I not reason, think ye, to make haste,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And seek their ruin that usurp'd our right?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The midwife wonder'd and the women cried

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 'O, Jesus bless us, he is born with teeth!'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And so I was; which plainly signified

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That I should snarl and bite and play the dog.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Then, since the heavens have shaped my body so,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Let hell make crook'd my mind to answer it.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I have no brother, I am like no brother;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And this word 'love,' which graybeards call divine,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Be resident in men like one another

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And not in me: I am myself alone.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Clarence, beware; thou keep'st me from the light:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But I will sort a pitchy day for thee;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For I will buz abroad such prophecies

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That Edward shall be fearful of his life,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And then, to purge his fear, I'll be thy death.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: King Henry and the prince his son are gone:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Clarence, thy turn is next, and then the rest,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Counting myself but bad till I be best.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I'll throw thy body in another room

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And triumph, Henry, in thy day of doom.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 3 KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Once more we sit in England's royal throne,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Re-purchased with the blood of enemies.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: What valiant foemen, like to autumn's corn,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Have we mow'd down, in tops of all their pride!

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Three Dukes of Somerset, threefold renown'd

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: For hardy and undoubted champions;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Two Cliffords, as the father and the son,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And two Northumberlands; two braver men

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Thus have we swept suspicion from our seat

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And made our footstool of security.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Come hither, Bess, and let me kiss my boy.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Young Ned, for thee, thine uncles and myself

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Have in our armours watch'd the winter's night,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Went all afoot in summer's scalding heat,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: That thou mightst repossess the crown in peace;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And of our labours thou shalt reap the gain.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside  I'll blast his harvest, if your head were laid;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For yet I am not look'd on in the world.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: This shoulder was ordain'd so thick to heave;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And heave it shall some weight, or break my back:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Work thou the way,--and thou shalt execute.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Clarence and Gloucester, love my lovely queen;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And kiss your princely nephew, brothers both.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: The duty that I owe unto your majesty

speaker: CLARENCE
line: I seal upon the lips of this sweet babe.

speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH
line: Thanks, noble Clarence; worthy brother, thanks.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And, that I love the tree from whence thou sprang'st,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Aside  To say the truth, so Judas kiss'd his master,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And cried 'all hail!' when as he meant all harm.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Now am I seated as my soul delights,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Having my country's peace and brothers' loves.

speaker: CLARENCE
line: What will your grace have done with Margaret?

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Reignier, her father, to the king of France

speaker: CLARENCE
line: Hath pawn'd the Sicils and Jerusalem,

speaker: CLARENCE
line: And hither have they sent it for her ransom.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Away with her, and waft her hence to France.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: And now what rests but that we spend the time

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Such as befits the pleasure of the court?

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: Sound drums and trumpets! farewell sour annoy!

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
line: For here, I hope, begins our lasting joy.
